meta.title: Colonial School District, Plymouth Meeting, PA

meta.name: description
meta.content: Colonial School District uses a team approach for working and learning, encourages creative critical thinking to solve problems and promotes a climate of continuous improvement.
Colonial School District uses a team approach for working and learning, encourages creative critical thinking to solve problems and promotes a climate of continuous improvement.
Colonial School District, Plymouth Meeting, PA

body.class: fsLiveMode fsHasHeader fsHasFooter fsHasOneColumnLayout home fsHasTheme2 district-theme

a.title: Colonial School District Logo and link to home page

br.br: With approximately 5,000 students and 700 employees, Colonial School District embraces a team approach to working and learning, encourages creative critical thinking to solve problems and fosters continuous improvement.

Colonial School District’s academic curriculum challenges students to explore and discover new concepts and skills through project-based learning, integrated lessons and making real world connections.

The Colonial School District covers Conshohocken Borough and Plymouth and Whitemarsh townships, in a thriving area of southeastern Pennsylvania that serves as a destination to live, shop, work and learn.

img.alt: Students in the community with police officers

br.br: Are you looking for a job in the Colonial School District? Click here to visit our Human Resources page!

Whether donating time, expertise or dollars, community support of the Colonial School District helps our schools to continue providing students the resources and experiences they need to be “future ready.”

img.alt: Colonial School District Education Logo. Together we'll build the future.

br.br: The Colonial School Board is in the process of moving to an online archive and organizational system called "BoardDocs" that will eventually house all of the School Board information. Many of the links to the right will take you directly to BoardDocs.

li.a: Agendas and Minutes Archives (1997 through April 2018)
Agendas and Minutes Archives (1997 through April 2018)

section.class: fsElement fsNews fsSlideshow home-news fsItemCount_9 fsSlideshowHorizontal fsThumbnailRectangle fsThumbnailLarge

div.title: Montgomery County Recruitment Outreach Virtual Education Career Fair: May 7

img.alt: Montgomery County Recruitment Outreach Virtual Education Career Fair: May 7

div.a: Montgomery County Recruitment Outreach Virtual Education Career Fair: May 7

div.p: Are you looking for a career in education? Pre-register by May 4 on the MCIU website: www.mciu.org/mcro to talk to area school districts, including Colonial.

article.a: Read more about Montgomery County Recruitment Outreach Virtual Education Career Fair: May 7

div.title: Planting seeds on Earth Day at Whitemarsh Elementary

img.alt: Planting seeds on Earth Day at Whitemarsh Elementary

div.a: Planting seeds on Earth Day at Whitemarsh Elementary

div.p: One of Colonial School District's K-3 activities for Earth Day was to plant something in a garden or create a garden using paper cups and soil.

article.a: Read more about Planting seeds on Earth Day at Whitemarsh Elementary

div.title: Conshohocken Elem. School Nurse shares Earth Day song

img.alt: Conshohocken Elem. School Nurse shares Earth Day song

div.a: Conshohocken Elem. School Nurse shares Earth Day song

div.p: Mrs. Cupo performed "Walk Through These Woods" with her father, Singer/Songwriter Glen Waldeck. Click here to watch the video on Facebook!

article.a: Read more about Conshohocken Elem. School Nurse shares Earth Day song

div.p: After a brief layoff, workers were back on site the week of April 13.

article.a: Read more about Middle school construction resumes

div.title: Colonial Elementary named a top school in NFL Play 60

img.alt: Colonial Elementary named a top school in NFL Play 60

div.a: Colonial Elementary named a top school in NFL Play 60

p.a: Click here for a special message from Rodney McLeod, Safety for the Philadelphia Eagles.

article.a: Read more about Colonial Elementary named a top school in NFL Play 60

div.title: Where is the PWHS Class of 2020 headed?

img.alt: Where is the PWHS Class of 2020 headed?

div.a: Where is the PWHS Class of 2020 headed?

div.p: Click here to go to visit the student-run PW 2020 Futures page on Instagram! Find where the PWHS seniors are going, including college, military and more!

article.a: Read more about Where is the PWHS Class of 2020 headed?

div.title: Class of 2020 videos online and CITV

img.alt: Class of 2020 videos online and CITV

div.a: Class of 2020 videos online and CITV

div.p: Watch the senior nights for this year's sports, the Class of 2020's third grade concerts and more on the District YouTube channel and on CITV!

article.a: Read more about Class of 2020 videos online and CITV

div.title: School Board to hold virtual public meetings

img.alt: School Board to hold virtual public meetings

div.a: School Board to hold virtual public meetings

div.p: Meetings will enable public participation while adhering to social distancing guidelines.

article.a: Read more about School Board to hold virtual public meetings

div.p: Updating the District's response to the developing situation.

section.class: fsElement fsCalendar fsSlideshow home-calendar fsItemCount_10 fsSlideshowHorizontal

div.p: Stay informed on Colonial School District and the Coronavirus (COVID-19).

a.title: link to COVID19
a.strong: Click here for links and updates!

div.div: Find out what's happening locally and search for community clubs and sports teams.

a.strong: Click here to go to the Community Announcements page!

section.div:
Every day in the Colonial School District, students, teachers and staff look for ways to help others and give back to our community and world.
Click here to read more about it!

div.p: The Colonial School District is committed to ensuring that all material on its website is accessible to students, faculty, staff and the general public. If you experience difficulty with the accessibility of any web pages or documents, please contact Kim Newell via e-mail at webmaster@colonialsd.org to request our materials in an alternate format.
